critique: This executive order amends a previous one regarding the National Council on Indian Opportunity. It primarily deals with the composition of the council, specifying the members. There's no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, executive power shift, federalism changes, security vs. liberty concerns, or economic regulation. However, it does touch upon social inclusion by focusing on Indian affairs and including Indian leaders in the council. The amendment itself doesn't drastically alter the council's purpose or power, so the impact on most axes is minimal. The inclusion of Indian leaders suggests a move towards greater inclusivity.
